name: Stars Hospital
description: Stars Hospital is a moderately equipped but poorly managed medical facility in Cassandra. While outwardly functional, it suffers from lax internal control, uneven security coverage, and signs of external interference with its digital systems. It is a critical investigative location connected to the handling of Lucifero’s body.

snapshot.name: Stars Hospital
snapshot.description: The hospital operates normally on the surface, with staff accustomed to routine police inquiries. Surveillance cameras cover most areas but leave exploitable blind spots. Certain internal departments—particularly medical storage and laboratories—are unusually well protected. The morgue records indicate suspicious recent activity.

characters.name: Vincent Galenus
characters.notes: Personally transported Lucifero’s body to the crematorium according to hospital records. Possesses an ID card required to access restricted areas.

characters.name: Lucifero
characters.notes: Hospital records show the body was registered and then rapidly transferred out. The corpse is no longer in the morgue.

clues.clueText: Hospital surveillance system is unusually resistant to hacking and intrusion.
clues.discoveryMethod: Consulting Simon or attempting system intrusion
reveals: Someone has deliberately reinforced the hospital’s digital security
The hospital is concealing sensitive activity

clues.clueText: Two areas stand out as suspicious: the pharmaceutical storage room and the laboratory.
clues.discoveryMethod: Technical analysis or consultation with Simon
reveals: Restricted access areas likely tied to illicit experimentation or evidence handling

clues.clueText: Morgue records show Lucifero’s body was transferred to the crematorium very recently by Vincent himself.
reveals: Vincent Galenus is directly involved in the body’s disappearance
The crematorium is a new investigative lead

clues.clueText: Lucifero’s corpse is missing from the morgue despite being officially logged.
reveals: Urgency and concealment surrounding the victim

conditions.description: Clinical fluorescent lighting throughout most areas; dimmer conditions near storage and service corridors.
Routine hospital ambience—distant footsteps, carts, and ventilation noise.
Surveillance coverage with exploitable blind spots.
conditions.mechanicalEffect: Stealth and infiltration possible with planning

events: Investigators may disguise themselves as police to access the hospital without suspicion
Failed disguises require alternate infiltration methods
Simon warns that forced hacking risks triggering alarms
Discovery that the body has already been moved escalates the investigation

exits.description: Public-facing entrance used by staff, patients, and visitors
Used for transporting bodies and supplies

snapshot.keeperNotes: Stars Hospital is a pivotal escalation point. Evidence here confirms deliberate concealment and pushes the investigation toward Vincent and the crematorium. Use surveillance pressure and time sensitivity to increase tension.
permanentChanges: Lucifero’s body is no longer accessible in the hospital once discovered missing

connections.description: Stars Hospital is listed under and accessed from Avenue of Stars during the investigation.
Hospital records indicate Lucifero’s body was transferred there by Vincent.
